info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 07 at 7:12AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A THUNDERSTORM WITH INTENSE LIGHTNING AND TORRENTIAL RAINFALL WILL IMPACT EASTERN LINCOLN...NORTHWESTERN MECKLENBURG...SOUTHEASTERN CLEVELAND...GASTON...NORTHWESTERN YORK AND NORTHEASTERN CHEROKEE COUNTIES UNTIL 800 AM EDT... At 711 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a thunderstorm with intense lightning and torrential rainfall 12 miles southwest of Gastonia, or near Kings Mountain State Park, moving northeast at 35 mph. Locations to be impacted include... Gastonia, Huntersville, Kings Mountain, Mt Holly, Belmont, Bessemer City, South Gastonia, Dallas, Stanley and Cramerton. Very heavy rainfall rates up to 1 to 2 inches per hour will be possible in these areas. Deep ponding may develop in low-lying spots on area roadways.
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall may flood areas with poor drainage, such as ditches and underpasses. Avoid these areas and do not cross flooded roads. Water levels of small streams may also rise rapidly. Seek higher ground if threatened by flood waters. Frequent lightning is occurring with this storm. If outdoors, try to get indoors or into a hard topped vehicle. Otherwise, stay away from open areas and isolated high objects such as trees. When indoors, stay away from windows and doors and avoid using wired electronic devices.
